types.name: AccountLink
types.description: The information for a third-party account link.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The account links UUID

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The name displayed on the third-party account site.

fields.name: accountType
fields.description: The type of account for the account link (usually a publisher name).

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current state of the account link.

types.name: AccountLinkConfig
types.description: Account linking configuration for a third party.

fields.name: accountType
fields.description:
The type of account for the account link (usually a publisher name). Only
present for third parties where account links are stored by Twitch Prime

fields.name: linkingUrl
fields.description: The URL to direct the user to link their game account to their Twitch Prime account.

fields.name: linkingInstructions
fields.description: Instructions for linking an account

fields.name: linkedAccountConfirmation
fields.description: Confirmation text for a user who has linked

fields.name: thirdPartyAccountManagementUrl
fields.description: A URL to the page where users can manage and remove their third party account link

types.name: AccountLinkStatus
types.description: An indicator for the account link's status in our system.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The account link is currently being used by the customer and third-party.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: The account link is marked as no longer in use but kept for historical purposes.

types.name: Alert
types.description: Notification that should be shown to the customer

fields.name: type
fields.description: What form does the alert take.

fields.name: button
fields.description: A call to action to redirect a customer to an external page.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Information about a situation or knowledge the customer needs.

fields.name: order
fields.description: Priority of the notification

types.name: AlertButton
types.description: A call to action.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text to be shown in the button.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Where the button redirects to.

types.name: BlockMetadata
types.description: Unstructured key/value object describing appearance of a page element block

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Built-in Boolean

types.name: ClaimJourneyOfferError
types.description: Error code for an error that occurs while claiming a journey offer.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while claiming a journey offer.

types.name: ClaimJourneyOfferErrorCode
types.description: Error types recognized.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

enumValues.name: ENTITY_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Status when the offerId or journeyId not found.

enumValues.name: INELIGIBLE_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: Status when the customer account is not eligible for claim.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: Status when user is not logged in to an Amazon account.

inputFields.name: journeyId
inputFields.description: Unique Identifier for a journey.

inputFields.name: offerId
inputFields.description: Unique Identifier for an offer.

inputFields.name: dateOverride
inputFields.description:
Optional - Date override in UTC to claim the campaigns available for a
specific date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.

inputFields.name: isClaimCode
inputFields.description: If the offer being claimed is claim-code based

types.name: ClaimJourneyOfferPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after claiming the journey and offer, in this case, the entitlement.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The connection contains both journey and offer.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

fields.name: journeyId
fields.description: Unique Identifier for a journey returned from the service.

fields.name: offerId
fields.description: Unique Identifier for an offer returned from the service.

types.name: ClaimJourneyOfferSelfConnection
types.description: Data that contains the journey offer claim status.

fields.name: offer
fields.description: The connection for whether the user is entitled to the offer.

types.name: ClaimPrimeOfferError
types.description: Error code for an error that occurs while claiming prime offer.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while claiming prime offer.

types.name: ClaimPrimeOfferErrorCode
types.description: Error types recognized.

enumValues.name: OFFER_ALREADY_CLAIMED
enumValues.description: Status when offer is already claimed by the current user or an associated account.

enumValues.name: OFFER_CLAIMED_ON_TWITCH_NOT_AMAZON
enumValues.description: Error when the offer is unclaimable because of an entitlement to the linked twitch account

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: Status when user is not logged in to an Amazon account.

enumValues.name: NO_SELECTED_TWITCH_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: Status when a user has no linked Twitch accounts, no selected Twitch account, or an invalid selected Twitch account.

enumValues.name: INELIGIBLE_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: Users Twitch Prime membership is in an invalid Prime marketplace for this Offer.

inputFields.name: offerID
inputFields.description: Unique Identifier for an offer.

inputFields.name: isFGWPClaim
inputFields.description:
Temporary parameter for indicating that a FGWP offer is being claimed.
Long term, we will deprecate this in favor of backend systems flexibly allowing claims of various types.

types.name: ClaimPrimeOfferPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after claiming the prime offer, in this case, the entitlement.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The connection for whether the user is entitled to the offer.

types.name: ConflictingClaimUser
types.description: Information for Household user who has already claimed the content.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: The user's full name. Will be blank if the customer does not have a full name (there are valid customer in this state).

fields.name: obfuscatedEmail
fields.description: The user's obfuscated email address. Ex: c******e@gmail.com.

types.name: Country
types.description:
"A country is a distinct territorial body or political entity. It is often
referred to as the land of an individual's birth, residence or citizenship." - Wikipedia.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 identifier for the country.

fields.name: primeGamingEligibility
fields.description: Prime Gaming eligibility for users in this country.

types.name: CountryPrimeEligibility
types.description: Descriptor for whether or not users in a country are eligible for Prime Gaming benefits.

enumValues.name: SUPPORTED
enumValues.description: Prime Gaming benefits are supported in this country.

enumValues.name: EMBARGOED
enumValues.description: Amazon is legally prohibited from doing business in this country.

enumValues.name: EXCLUDED
enumValues.description: Prime Gaming benefits are not yet offered in this country.

types.name: CreateAccountLinkError

fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while creating an account link.

types.description: Recognized error types for creating an account link.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: The Amazon customer who we are trying to link is not signed in

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

types.name: CreateAccountLinkInput
types.description: Information to create a link between an Amazon account and a third-party account

inputFields.name: accountType
inputFields.description: The third-party account type

inputFields.name: token
inputFields.description: The token that is associated with the third party account

inputFields.name: redirectUri
inputFields.description: The redirect URI that was used to get the token.

inputFields.name: overwrite
inputFields.description: Optional param to overwrite the existing account link

inputFields.name: clientId
inputFields.description: Optional param to specify a specific OAuth client ID

types.name: CreateAccountLinkPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after creating a link between an Amazon account and a third-party account.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

fields.name: account
fields.description: The information about the link that was created.

types.name: CurrentUser
types.description: Signed in customers information.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for a user

fields.name: email
fields.description: DEPRECATED: use obfuscatedEmail

fields.name: obfuscatedEmail
fields.description: The user's obfuscated email address. Ex: c******e@gmail.com.

fields.name: isSignedIn
fields.description: Details if the customer is signed in

fields.name: isTwitchPrime
fields.description:
Details if the customer is signed up for Twitch Prime. This will be true if
the user is Amazon Prime and they've gone through the Twitch Prime signup flow.

fields.name: isAmazonPrime
fields.description: Details if the customer is signed up for Amazon Prime.

fields.name: twitchAccounts
fields.description: The Twitch Accounts associated with the current signed in user.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description:
The first name of the current signed in user. Will be blank if the customer
does not have a first name (there are valid customer in this state).

fields.name: fullName
fields.description:
The full name of the current signed in user.  Will be blank if the customer
does not have a full name (there are valid customer in this state).

fields.name: primeSignupStatus
fields.description: The Twitch Prime signup status of the user.

fields.name: mobileVerificationUrl
fields.description: The url for additional mobile verification/setup for Twitch Prime signup. Currently not available for ROW countries.

fields.name: preferences
fields.description: The users preferences across Amazon and Twitch Prime

fields.name: dinoServices
fields.description: List of configurable Dino services/operations.

fields.description: Name of the service.

fields.name: operationName

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the service.

fields.name: operations
fields.description: List of configurable Dino operations in this service.

types.name: ItemCollectionType

types.name: Journey
types.description: An object containing grouped offers available based on time windows or eligibility

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the journey.

fields.name: offers
fields.description: List of offers associated with a Journey

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type for if a journey is a CAMPAIGN or JOURNEY

fields.name: self
fields.description: Connection for the current user

fields.name: assets
fields.description: Assets for the journey

fields.name: accountLink
fields.description:
The account link information for this Journey if thirdPartyAccountType is
present and the customer has already linked their account.

fields.name: accountLinkConfig
fields.description:
Configuration for the third-party account link for this Journey.
journeyShortName - name of the journey page used to validate the redirectUrl
passed to build the third party account link url
redirectUrl - page url user gets redirected to after linking their third party account
Optional - String debug will display the string id and locale for string assets

types.name: JourneyAssets
types.description: Assets for a Journey.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the journey.

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description: Subtitle describing the journey.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Longer description of the journey.

fields.name: legal
fields.description: Legal disclaimer text for journey.

fields.name: hero
fields.description: Main asset for the journey

fields.name: alertList
fields.description: Alerts to be shown to the customer to inform them about a status of the campaign

fields.name: claimInstructions
fields.description: Instructions for claiming offers in the journey

fields.name: claimVisualInstructions
fields.description: Image or video showing customers how to claim offers in the journey

fields.name: purchaseGameText
fields.description: Instructions for purchasing a game

fields.name: thirdPartySupportPageUrl
fields.description: The URL to the third party's (e.g. Riot's) technical support page

fields.name: thirdPartyAccountManagementUrl
fields.description: A URL to the page where users can manage and remove their third party account link

fields.name: platformAvailability
fields.description: The platforms supported by the game e.g. "Available on Xbox, PC, Switch"

fields.name: publisherName
fields.description: Publisher name of the journey

fields.name: catalogId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the catalog equivalent of the offer

fields.name: self
fields.description: Connection for the current user

fields.name: assets
fields.description: Assets for the journey offer.

fields.name: grantsCode
fields.description: Flag if the offer is claim-code based

fields.name: isFGWP
fields.description: Denotes if the journeyOffer is representing a FGWP offer

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The time at which the offer becomes available

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The time at which the offer is no longer available

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of journey offer.

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description: Subtitle that describes journey offer.

fields.name: header
fields.description: Optional header of journey offer that displays custom strings.

fields.name: card
fields.description: Main journey offer image or video.

fields.name: additionalMedia
fields.description: Additional images and videos for journey asset.

fields.name: items
fields.description: List of items available in the journey offer.

fields.name: pixels
fields.description: List of pixels to track offer actions

fields.name: externalClaimLink

types.name: JourneyOfferMarketplaceRestriction
types.description: An object containing information about an offer's marketplace restrictions

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Whether or not there is a marketplace restriction blocking claiming

types.name: JourneyOfferOtherClaim
types.description: An object containing information about another offer claim that may be blocking the current offer's availability

fields.name: isRequired
fields.description: Whether or not there is another offer that must be claimed before this journey offer is available

types.name: JourneyOfferSelfConnection
types.description: An object containing information about a Journey Offer for the current user

fields.name: claimStatus
fields.description: The status for if a journey offer is AVAILABLE, FUTURE, EXPIRED, etc.

fields.name: claimData
fields.description: The claim data (link, text, or claim code) for the Journey Offer

fields.name: claimableAt
fields.description: Time at which the offer becomes claimable

fields.name: marketplaceRestriction
fields.description: The data about the offer's marketplace restriction

fields.name: otherClaim
fields.description: The data about the offer's other relevant offer claims

fields.name: conflictingAccounts
fields.description:
Represents accounts a user has already claimed from, thus removing their
eligibility to claim a particular journey offer (e.g. TWITCH, AMAZON, BLIZZARD).

fields.name: eligibility
fields.description:
Represents the user's ability to claim an offer
Optional - getOnlyActiveOffers excludes eligibility data for offers that are inactive (future or expired).

fields.name: orderInformation
fields.description: Represents data that was used to previously claim this offer

types.name: JourneyOfferStatus
types.description: Possible values for the status of a Journey Offer

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: Offer can be claimed now

enumValues.name: CLAIMED
enumValues.description: Offer has been claimed by the user

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: Offer has expired and is no longer claimable

enumValues.name: FUTURE
enumValues.description: Offer is not yet available

types.name: JourneySelfConnection
types.description: An object containing information about a Journey for the current user

fields.name: enrollmentStatus
fields.description: The status for if a journey is AVAILABLE, FUTURE, EXPIRED, etc.

types.name: JourneyStatus
types.description: Possible values for the status of a Journey

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: Journey can be enrolled in now

enumValues.name: CLAIMED
enumValues.description: Journey is CLAIMED when the user claims at least 1 journey offer

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: Journey has expired and is no longer available

enumValues.name: FUTURE
enumValues.description: Journey is not yet available

types.name: JourneyType
types.description: Possible values for the type of Journey

enumValues.name: JOURNEY
enumValues.description: Type if Journey where offers are available based eligibility rules

types.name: LinkTwitchAccountError
types.description: Error that occurs while creating an account link.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while creating the account link.

fields.name: backoffMilliseconds
fields.description: When the ACCOUNT_UNAVAILABLE error code is present, the call can be retried after waiting this length of time.

types.name: LinkTwitchAccountErrorCode
types.description: Recognized error types for creating an account link.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: The Amazon customer who we are trying to link is not signed in

enumValues.name: TWITCH_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_LINKED
enumValues.description:
The Twitch account trying to be linked is linked to another Amazon account.
Shouldn't happen because we unlink the Twitch account from any existing
accounts before linking to the new account.

enumValues.name: TOO_MANY_LINKS
enumValues.description: The number of currently linked Twitch accounts to the current Amazon is greater than the maximum.

enumValues.name: INVALID_TOKEN
enumValues.description: The given auth token was either expired or did not match the current customer ID.

enumValues.name: ACCOUNT_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The given account was not available to be linked at this time. Can be retried based on the backoffMilliseconds field.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

enumValues.name: NO_TOKEN_PROVIDED
enumValues.description: neither `oAuthToken` or `authToken` is provided in LinkTwitchAccountInput, must provided one of them.

enumValues.name: INVALID_PARAMETER
enumValues.description: his is client error(4xx) from Tails when call GetTwitchUserInfo, includes invalid token error.

types.name: LinkTwitchAccountInput
types.description:
Information to create a link between an Amazon account and a Twitch account.
Provide either JWT token or OAuth token, if they both provided, we take OAuth token.

inputFields.name: authToken
inputFields.description: Authorization token representing a Twitch account, generated by the twitchUserAuthToken query. This is JWT token.

inputFields.name: oAuthToken
inputFields.description: Twitch OAuth token.

types.name: LinkTwitchAccountPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after creating a link between an Amazon account and a Twitch account.

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: The updated current user with the new Twitch account linked.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

types.name: MarkPrimeOffersAsSeenError
types.description: Error code for an error that occurs while marking the offers as seen.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while marking the offers as seen.

types.name: MarkPrimeOffersAsSeenErrorCode
types.description: Error types recognized.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: Status when user is not logged in to an Amazon account.

enumValues.name: NO_LINKED_TWITCH_ACCOUNTS
enumValues.description: Status when a user has no linked Twitch accounts.

enumValues.name: NO_SELECTED_TWITCH_ACCOUNT
enumValues.description: Status when a user has no selected Twitch account.

inputFields.name: offerIDs
inputFields.description: Unique Identifiers for a list of offers.

types.name: MarkPrimeOffersAsSeenPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after marking the offers as seen.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

types.name: Media
types.description: Media type for displaying content

fields.name: defaultMedia
fields.description: Default image asset, for mobile and higher.

fields.name: tablet
fields.description: Tablet specific image asset.

fields.name: desktop
fields.description: Desktop specific image asset.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Text describing the asset in a marketing context.

fields.name: alt
fields.description: Text describing the asset.

fields.name: videoPlaceholderImage
fields.description: Default image to render while a video is loading

types.name: MediaAsset
types.description: JPEG, PNG Media

fields.name: src1x
fields.description: Source used for non-retina displays.

fields.name: src2x
fields.description: Source used for retina displays.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of media -- eg image, video.

types.name: MediaType
types.description: Possible medium for media.

fields.name: placeOrder
fields.description: placeOrder allows a user to create their entitlement to the given offer/content.

fields.name: placeOrders
fields.description: Creates entitlements for the current user on an offers/content

fields.name: claimPrimeOffer
fields.description: claimPrimeOffer allows a user to create their entitlement to the given offer/content.

fields.name: markPrimeOffersAsSeen
fields.description: markPrimeOffersAsSeen emits an SNS event indicating that a user has seen the given offers/content.

fields.name: createAccountLink
fields.description: Allows the creation of a link between an Amazon account and third-party account

fields.name: linkTwitchAccount
fields.description: Link a twitch account to the logged in Amazon user.

fields.name: unlinkTwitchAccount
fields.description: Unlink a twitch account from the logged in Amazon user.

fields.name: signupForPrime
fields.description: signupForPrime allows a user to sign up for Twitch Prime without requiring a twitch account to be linked.

fields.name: claimJourneyOffer
fields.description: claimJourneyOffer allows a user to create their entitlement to a given journey and offer.

fields.name: updateNotificationSettings
fields.description: updateNotificationSettings allows a user to be enabled or disabled for email notification

fields.name: updateTopicSubscription
fields.description: updateTopicSubscription allows a user to be subscribed or unsubscribed notification for a specific topic

fields.name: unsubscribeFromNotificationsWithToken
fields.description: Allows a user to globally unsubscribe from all Prime Gaming email notifications without logging in.

fields.name: subscribeToNotificationsWithToken
fields.description: Allows a user to globally subscribe to all Prime Gaming email notifications without logging in.

types.name: NotificationPreferences
types.description: User's notification preferences on the notification setting page

fields.name: emailNotificationOptIn
fields.description: Has the user opted out of email notification

fields.name: notificationSubscriptions
fields.description:
Sign in user's notification subscriptions information on the notification setting page
pageSize - pageSize for showing the topics on the notification setting page, default is set to 50
token - current pagination parameter on the notification setting page

types.name: NotificationSubscriptionTopic
types.description: An object containing information about the topic for the current user

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the topic

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the topic

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the topic

fields.name: self
fields.description: The relationship between the current user and the topic

types.name: NotificationSubscriptionTopicSelfConnection
types.description: An object containing the relationship between the current user and the topic

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: Flag tracking if the user has subscribed to the topic

types.name: NotificationSubscriptionsPage
types.description: A page of NotificationSubscriptionTopics

fields.name: nextToken
fields.description: Page pagination parameter

fields.name: notificationSubscriptionTopics
fields.description: Contain information about the topics for the current user

types.name: NotificationTopicType
types.description: Current NotificationTopicType only contains GAME. In the future, if introducing new type, please add here.

enumValues.name: GAME
enumValues.description: Current NotificationTopicType only contains GAME type

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the offer

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: The time at which the offer becomes available

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: The time at which the offer is no nonger available

fields.name: offerSelfConnection
fields.description: An object containing information about a customer's relation to the offer

types.name: OfferEligibility
types.description: Contains information about a user's ability to claim an offer

fields.name: isClaimed
fields.description: Boolean representing if the customer or member of customer's Household has claimed the offer

fields.name: canClaim
fields.description: Boolean representing if the customer has passed eligibility checks and can claim the offer

fields.name: conflictingClaimAccount
fields.description: An Amazon Household account that already claimed the offer.

fields.name: conflictingThirdPartyAccounts
fields.description: Third party accounts that have already claimed the offer.

fields.name: isPrimeGaming
fields.description: Boolean representing if the customer has a valid prime gaming account in order to claim the offer

fields.name: missingRequiredAccountLink
fields.description:
Boolean to specify if the customer needs to link an account to be able to claim,
if the offer requires an account link and the customer has already link that account this would be false

fields.name: gameAccountDisplayName
fields.description: Username for the linked 3p account a customer will claim an offer with

fields.name: offerStartTime
fields.description: The first time at which the offer can be claimed

fields.name: offerEndTime
fields.description: The time at which the offer can no longer be claimed

fields.name: claimTime
fields.description: The most recent time at which the offer was claimed by the customer

fields.name: offerState
fields.description: The status of an offer

fields.name: inRestrictedMarketplace
fields.description:
Boolean representing if the offer is restricted in the user's marketplace,
this should be true if the customer can't claim it because of the marketplace they are in

fields.name: maxOrdersExceeded
fields.description: Represents if the customer or customer's Household has already ordered the offer the maximum number of times

types.name: OfferOrderInformation
types.description: Information about a user's order of an offer.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the order

fields.name: catalogOfferId
fields.description: Unique identifier for catalog offer the order was placed for

fields.name: entitledAccountId
fields.description: Id for the account that the entitlement was created for

fields.name: entitledAccountName
fields.description: Name of the account when the order was placed

fields.name: orderDate
fields.description: Datetime when the order was placed

fields.name: claimCode
fields.description: A redeemable code associated with the order

fields.name: orderState
fields.description:
Used to determine the state of the order that was just placed
Will return null by default if there is an unexpected error

fields.name: isLegacyCodeOrder
fields.description: Boolean to specify that the order information constructed is for a code offer claimed on the legacy path

types.name: OfferOrderRetrievalDetails
types.description: Details about the orders which are being retrieved for a specific offer

inputFields.name: offerId
inputFields.description: Optional - offerId will retrieve all of the customer's orders that are for that offerId

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: Optional - orderId will retrieve that specific order. An orderId can not be passed in without an offerId

fields.name: claimInstructions
fields.description:
Instructions on how to redeem the items that have been claimed.
Supplied in Markdown.

fields.name: claimData
fields.description: The data (link, text, or claim code) for the entitlement that was created.

fields.name: hasEntitlement
fields.description: Indicates whether the user has been entitled.

fields.name: eligibility
fields.description:
Represents the user's ability to claim an offer
Optional - onlyActiveOffers excludes eligibility data for offers that are inactive (future or expired).

fields.name: orderInformation
fields.description: Represents data that was used to previously claim this offer

types.name: OfferState
types.description: Possible values for the state of an offer

enumValues.name: LIVE
enumValues.description: The offer is available for claiming

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The offer is no longer available for claiming

enumValues.name: FUTURE
enumValues.description: The offer is not yet available for claiming but will be in the future

types.name: OrderState
types.description: Possible values for the state of an order

enumValues.name: PROCESSING
enumValues.description: The initial state of the order and changes when the order is closed

enumValues.name: SUCCEEDED
enumValues.description: The order has been processed and closed successfully. The user has also received the entitlement.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
The order was completed unsuccessfully as an expected failure.
Ex: The customer failed ordering eligibility checks.

types.name: PageConfiguration
types.description: Information related to a user's page configuration

fields.name: menuPath
fields.description: Additional information for determining what else to show to a specific user

fields.name: pageElementBlocks
fields.description: Page elements as a list of object blocks, null if a page does not exist

fields.name: journeyId
fields.description: Journey id for a page configuration

fields.name: redirectPath
fields.description: Where the user should be redirected, used if a page does not exist

fields.name: pageHeader
fields.description: Used as HTML Page Title

types.name: PageElementBlock
types.description: Information about a page element

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of page element block i.e. MoreFromPrime, PrimeShipping

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata describing appearance of the page element block, i.e. backgroundColor

types.name: Pixel
types.description: A pixel used for tracking and re-targeting customers based on interactions

fields.name: type
fields.description: The specific interaction which will trigger the pixel

fields.name: pixel
fields.description: Advertising pixel content

types.name: PixelFireEventType
types.description: Types of interaction events which will fire a pixel

enumValues.name: PAGEVIEW
enumValues.description: Pixel is fired when the page is viewed/loaded

enumValues.name: CLAIM_SUCCESS
enumValues.description: Pixel is fired when the user claim action completes successfully

enumValues.name: CLAIM_ACTION
enumValues.description: Pixel is fired when the user makes an action to claim an offer

types.name: PlaceOrderError
types.description: Error code for an error that occurs while claiming an offer

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while claiming an offer

types.name: PlaceOrderErrorCode
types.description: Error types recognized.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: Status when user is not logged in to an Amazon account.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

inputFields.name: offerId
inputFields.description: Unique identifier for an offer

inputFields.name: idempotentKey
inputFields.description: A key that represents a specific order request

inputFields.name: attributionChannel
inputFields.description:
JSON blob containing data about where an order is taking place
ex: '{eventId: "xyzas234nv2", page: "ODP", url: "https://twitch.amazon.com/prime/loot/destiny2?ref_=SM_D204_CRWN"}'

inputFields.name: dateOverride
inputFields.description:
Optional - Date override in UTC to view the offers available for a specific
date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.

fields.name: error

types.description: Error code for an error that occurs while claiming an offer

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for error that occurred while claiming an offer

types.description: Error types recognized.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: Status when user is not logged in to an Amazon account.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

inputFields.name: offerIds
inputFields.description: Ids for the offer which are being entitled

inputFields.name: attributionChannel
inputFields.description:
JSON blob containing data about where an order is taking place
ex: '{eventId: "xyzas234nv2", page: "ODP", url: "https://twitch.amazon.com/prime/loot/destiny2?ref_=SM_D204_CRWN"}'

inputFields.name: dateOverride

Optional - Date override in UTC to view the offers available for a specific
date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.

types.name: PlaceOrdersPayload
types.description: Data that was mutated after claiming a set of offers

fields.name: orderInformation
fields.description: Updated order information on offers

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name associated with the benefit

fields.name: headline
fields.description: A brief sentence fragment that describes the benefit as a whole

fields.name: subheadline
fields.description: A supplemental sentence fragment that adds to the headline introduces the benefit details

fields.name: details
fields.description: List of strings enumerating the specifics of how a customer can use the benefit

fields.name: gameBenefits
fields.description: Details for the games and loot benefits and null if the benefit is not available

fields.name: shippingBenefits
fields.description: Details for the shipping benefits and null if the benefit is not available

fields.name: videoBenefits
fields.description: Details for the prime video benefits and null if the benefit is not available

fields.name: twitchBenefits
fields.description: Details for the Twitch benefits and null if the benefit is not available

fields.name: primeOffer
fields.description: String describing possible free trial and cost of Prime

fields.name: benefitSummaryList
fields.description: List of strings describing a summary of all prime benefits for a country

types.name: PrimeMarketplace
types.description: An Amazon Marketplace where Prime benefits are supported, either through traditional Prime or Prime Video.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Primary identifier for a Prime Marketplace. Can vary between Beta/Prod.

fields.name: marketplaceCode
fields.description: Shorthand identifier for a Prime Marketplace (e.g., US, DE, ROW_NA, etc.).

types.name: PrimeOffer
types.description: A digital entitlement that is displayed to a user.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifer for the offer.

fields.name: asin
fields.description: Unique identifier for the retail equivalent of the offer

fields.name: catalogId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the catalog equivalent of the offer

fields.name: content
fields.description: Metadata for the content being offered.

fields.name: deliveryMethod
fields.description: Offer entitlement method.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Information about what is being offered.
Supplied in Markdown.

fields.name: assets
fields.description: Images, videos, gifs, used to display the offer content.

fields.name: offerAssets
fields.description: Images, videos, gifs, grouped by purposed and used to display the offer content.

fields.name: priority
fields.description:
Ranking for which the offer should be displayed ordered asc.
An item with 0 priority would be shown before an item with 100 priority.

fields.name: self
fields.description: Connection for the current user.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Metadata related to the categorization of the offer (e.g. Free Games with Prime).

fields.name: title
fields.description: Primary title for the offer.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time at which the offer is available.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time at which the offer stops being available.

fields.name: productList
fields.description: The list of products being offered.

fields.name: linkedJourney
fields.description:
Journey associated with a prime offer
Some PrimeOffers are linked to external Journey detail pages where the customer can claim content

fields.name: game
fields.description: Game containing relevant data

fields.name: isRetailLinkOffer
fields.description: Indicator to determine if the offer is a retail offer.

fields.name: relatedGameId
fields.description: The id of the related base game metadata

fields.name: relatedGameTitle
fields.description: The title of the related base game metadata

types.name: PrimeOfferAsset
types.description: Media used for showing what is being offered.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Media type.

fields.name: purpose
fields.description: What is the media being used for.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Media url used to show the content of an offer.

fields.name: location2x
fields.description: Media url for the 2x version of the asset, usually used for Hi Resolution.

types.name: PrimeOfferAssets
types.description: Images, videos, gifs, grouped by purposed and used to display the offer content.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Offer ID for which the assets relate to.

fields.name: screenshots
fields.description: Screenshots of the offer item or game.

fields.name: pixels
fields.description: List of pixels to track offer actions

types.name: PrimeOfferContent
types.description: Metadata the digital goods being offered.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: Categorization for content's game.

fields.name: externalURL
fields.description: If the content has an external marketing page (Blizzard, Retail, etc), some offers will have no external URL.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The publisher of the content

types.name: PrimeOfferProduct
types.description: The product that is offered.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: The SKU of the offered product.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: The vendor of the offered product.

types.name: PrimeOfferTag
types.description: Metadata strings for the purpose of the offer

fields.name: type
fields.description: Who is the audience or how is the tag grouped.

fields.name: tag
fields.description: The tagged value

types.name: PrimeSignupStatus
types.description:
Status of an Twitch Prime signup
SUCCEEDED - Customer has Twitch Prime status enabled
PENDING - Customer is waiting for Twitch Prime status to be enabled
FAILED - Customer's Twitch Prime status has failed to be enabled
MOBILE_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED - Customer's Twitch Prime status requires
additional mobile verification before it can be enabled
UNKNOWN - Customer has Twitch Prime status is unknown

fields.name: primeOffers
fields.description:
Get the currently available Twitch Prime Offers.
Optional - Date override in UTC to view the offers available for a specific
date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.
Optional - Group filter restricts the returned offers to the ones that contain a group tag equal to the one passed.

fields.name: journey
fields.description:
Get a Journey by its ID
Optional - Date override in UTC to view the journey on a specific date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.
Optional - String debug will display the string id and locale for string assets

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: Get the Twitch Prime user information for the current signed in user.

fields.name: weblabTreatment
fields.description:
Evaluate the weblab for the current user.
This query also triggers the weblab, so take care to only execute the query
when the customer will actually be interacting with the relevant experience.

fields.name: weblabTreatmentList
fields.description:
Evaluate the list of weblabs for the current user.
This query does not query the weblabs.

fields.name: accountLinks
fields.description: Get the third-party account links for the given types

fields.name: twitchUserAuthToken
fields.description:
Get a short-lived auth token representing a Twitch user. The token can be used
to fetch basic Twitch Account info, or to link the Twitch Account to the current user.

fields.name: twitchAccountFromAuthToken
fields.description: Get basic Twitch Account information from the passed in Twitch user auth token.

fields.name: primeBenefitStrings
fields.description:
Get sets of translated strings associated with benefits for the detected country of the user
Returns null if country is not supported by Amazon (embargoed)
primeMarketplaceCountryCode - (Optional) used to override the user's country code.

fields.name: pageConfiguration
fields.description:
Custom configuration for a requested page.
Optional - String debug will display the string id and locale for string assets

fields.name: orders
fields.description:
Retrieves all of the customer's orders if no parameters are passed in
Optional - offerId will retrieve all of the customer's orders that are for that offerId
Optional - orderId will retrieve that specific order. An orderId can not be passed in without an offerId
Optional - orders will retrieve specific information for the order information passed in

fields.name: developerConsoleOptions
fields.description: Supported configuration options made available through the developer console.

fields.name: primeMarketplace
fields.description:
The Amazon Marketplace for the user - either real or a best guess for non-Prime users.
If non-Prime, based on Country of Residence.
If authed and Prime, based on real Marketplace.
If the user has Prime in multiple Marketplaces, returns the one that matches the users Country of Residence.
Returns null if the User's countryOfResidence is not supported (EXCLUDED/EMBARGOED).

fields.name: countryOfResidence
fields.description: Country where the current user resides.

fields.name: item
fields.description:
Get an Item by its ID
Optional - Date override in UTC to view the item on a specific date for allowlist accounts. Defaults to current time.
Optional - String debug will display the string id and locale for string assets
Optional - PreviewId is used to retrieve the previewed metadata for current Item

fields.name: items
fields.description: Get a paginated list of items based on input values.

args.name: pageSize
args.description: Number of items to fetch in a page.

args.name: token
args.description: Pagination token returned by last query.

args.name: collectionType
args.description: Which group of items to get.

args.name: dateOverride
args.description: Override the date used for discovery, eligibility, etc. Defaults to current time.

args.name: enableStringDebug
args.description: Whether or not to display string ID + locale for string assets.

types.name: SignupForPrimeError
types.description: Error code for error that occurred while signing up for Twitch Prime without a Twitch Account.

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_IN
enumValues.description: The Amazon customer is not logged in.

enumValues.name: INVALID_MARKETPLACE
enumValues.description: The marketplace on the user was Invalid

enumValues.name: NOT_SIGNED_UP_FOR_AMAZON_PRIME
enumValues.description: Status when customers account does not have Amazon Prime

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown error being returned from service.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on variable definitions.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar. 'specifiedByUrl' is a valid field

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field or enum value as deprecated

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
